acknowledgments.summary: Gjoko Krstic reported these vulnerabilities to Schneider Electric.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: Pelco VideoXpert Enterprise: all versions prior to 2.1

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: By sniffing communications, an unauthorized person can execute a directory traversal attack resulting in authentication bypass or session hijack.CVE-2017-9964 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.9 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric has released firmware Version 2.1 for VideoXpert to address these vulnerabilities. :
More information on the new firmware and the issues it was created to address can be found in Schneider Electric Security Notification SEVD-2017-339-01

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: Using a directory traversal attack, an unauthorized person can view web server files.CVE-2017-9965 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric has released firmware Version 2.1 for VideoXpert to address these vulnerabilities. :
More information on the new firmware and the issues it was created to address can be found in Schneider Electric Security Notification SEVD-2017-339-01

notes.text: By replacing certain files, an authorized user can obtain system privileges and the inserted code would execute at an elevated privilege level.CVE-2017-9966 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric has released firmware Version 2.1 for VideoXpert to address these vulnerabilities. :
More information on the new firmware and the issues it was created to address can be found in Schneider Electric Security Notification SEVD-2017-339-01
